title: cryptoaddictchie
author: cryptoaddictchie
content: Creating the thread to all forum users who are engaging on Linea Voyager Quest. Heads up to all, we can all discuss and help out each other upon completing this task for the Linea testnet campaign on galxe. Im starting off the discussion with the official link of Galxe campaign:https://galxe.com/Linea/campaign/GCzWYUZXj4Also its quite comparable the last quest with 2500 points to the normal quest of Linea through on chain and off chain weekly task. 11m total participants vs 300k plus means the difference are too big for real users. It seems farmers and bots are heavily joined. Hope to cut them down for the next remaining two weekly task for its completion.

comments.author: dbshck
comments.body: Quote from: cryptoaddictchie on June 17, 2023, 03:29:58 AMAlso its quite comparable the last quest with 2500 points to the normal quest of Linea through on chain and off chain weekly task. 11m total participants vs 300k plus means the difference are too big for real users. That's over 11m of sybil accounts. I'm glad that they put the First Class Citizen campaign. It's not foolproof but I guess it's quite effective.This week's campaign (Social and Entertainment Week) is frustrating. There are so many gas-consuming activities while the main faucet is still unavailable. I'm only half way through and already out of ETH for gas. Hopefully, they could fix the faucet and the Goerli<>Linea bridge soon.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: cryptoaddictchie on June 17, 2023, 03:29:58 AMCreating the thread to all forum users who are engaging on Linea Voyager Quest. Heads up to all, we can all discuss and help out each other upon completing this task for the Linea testnet campaign on galxe. Im starting off the discussion with the official link of Galxe campaign:https://galxe.com/Linea/campaign/GCzWYUZXj4Also its quite comparable the last quest with 2500 points to the normal quest of Linea through on chain and off chain weekly task. 11m total participants vs 300k plus means the difference are too big for real users. It seems farmers and bots are heavily joined. Hope to cut them down for the next remaining two weekly task for its completion. This is interesting to see at least it's a good take to have the weekend completed with this, it's another opportunity coming on the way through which only those that are ready to participate will partake in such, i think it's worth giving a try, I've also been around to see something like this coming from the source i could trust their delivery ability, i believe it's something one can give a tasteful experience on each bite.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: dbshck on June 17, 2023, 02:15:18 PMThat's over 11m of sybil accounts. I'm glad that they put the First Class Citizen campaign. It's not foolproof but I guess it's quite effective.Yes, it will cut those sybil. As if some does really have a workign social media accounts and dozen of own accounts for this. I could say thats a trmendous effort for a testnet like this if ever. So this commemorative nft confirmed from linea should really have a lot of utility specially a monetize airdrop.Quote from: dbshck on June 17, 2023, 02:15:18 PMThis week's campaign (Social and Entertainment Week) is frustrating. There are so many gas-consuming activities while the main faucet is still unavailable. I'm only half way through and already out of ETH for gas. Hopefully, they could fix the faucet and the Goerli<>Linea bridge soon.Probably one of my headache within this week. Oh too bad the congestion is really high due to the volume of tasks and users. Claim 1eth worth of Linea eth here: https://www.infura.io/faucet/linea Hope it helps. Ive got mine.

comments.author: dbshck
comments.body: Quote from: cryptoaddictchie on June 18, 2023, 01:09:27 AMClaim 1eth worth of Linea eth here: https://www.infura.io/faucet/linea Hope it helps. Ive got mine. Thanks, but it's still unavailable for me. I've also seen similar complaints from other users on Discord, so it seems like a widespread issue. I might just let the rest of the points go since we already got that 2,500 points from the First Class Citizen campaign. In the grand scheme of things, it shouldn't make a significant difference.Anyway, have you come across any rumors about the TGE date for Linea? Is it expected to take place this year?

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: dbshck on June 18, 2023, 03:22:14 PMThanks, but it's still unavailable for me. I've also seen similar complaints from other users on Discord, so it seems like a widespread issue.I think that the equivalent wallet on ethereum network must have balance to be able to receive the 1eth on linea network.Quote from: dbshck on June 18, 2023, 03:22:14 PMAnyway, have you come across any rumors about the TGE date for Linea? Is it expected to take place this year?That I dont have info yet since were on testnet yet. But maybe will also have some time for mainnet interaction then tge. But I assume they wont do it a bit later since thry already got footprint on community they dont wanna waste this traction and popularity on community and delay its tge.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Heads up to everyone. The Linea announced the 8th week of their 9 weeks campaign.https://twitter.com/LineaBuild/status/1673316868042682370?t=2d2ggvWeSeIP5aMgQntfZQ&s=19A lot of new dapps to try on new and existing dapps that has been partnered with linea. The points are comprises of 425 and more than 50 tasks. It seems this will be another headache week for participants.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Bumping for everyone who joined the linea testnet quest.The project announced their last and final week for testnet.https://twitter.com/LineaBuild/status/1676939036911599617?t=xwk4mk-6c8sJVNkE2bM81Q&s=19Surely everyone here have their hard time especially on week 8th. I myself didnt completed all of it. The task are really headache especially the network is clogged during the time I was doing. It ate a lot of lineaeth just to finish mostly of the task.

comments.author: youdacapt
comments.body: Quote from: cryptoaddictchie on July 06, 2023, 03:11:34 PMBumping for everyone who joined the linea testnet quest.The project announced their last and final week for testnet.https://twitter.com/LineaBuild/status/1676939036911599617?t=xwk4mk-6c8sJVNkE2bM81Q&s=19Surely everyone here have their hard time especially on week 8th. I myself didnt completed all of it. The task are really headache especially the network is clogged during the time I was doing. It ate a lot of lineaeth just to finish mostly of the task. The final week for the Linea testnet voyage is quite compensating (The week 9). All you need to do is just to retweet a twitter post and then vote on snapshot on what you think is your favorite Linea platform use case. To vote on the snapshot site; your only criteria is to hodl 0.1 Testnet Linea Ethereum tokens. Since the first class citizen voyage has rooted out bots and spammers; every qualified participants can look forward to Linea main net launch and rewards (if there is any) to celebrate the end of the Voyage event

comments.author: Bitstar_coin
comments.body: I think somebody should have a serious talk with linea team to ease up on the high trx fees already, they are making the test voyage exercise unbearable for most testers and if it was done on purpose, they have definately achieve their goal because the number of testers who could no complete their task on this voyage 8 are more than those who where able to successfully complete their task. I couldn't complete the cashmere task because of the ridiculous gas fees, imagine to bridge Leth to Furji Avalanche network fees was 12 Leth, lol. I was having fun in all previous voyage, 7 was a little hectic but 8 was icing on the cake. Stressful and annoying to say the least.

comments.author: nick_2017
comments.body: Hi all.I'm newbie in the topic of Testnets and Retrodrops, so I apologize in advance if the question is incorrect.Could you clarify whether it is too late to participate in this quest? Where can I find details about its timing?Thanks in advance!

comments.author: Bitstar_coin
comments.body: Quote from: nick_2017 on July 06, 2023, 07:06:22 PMHi all.I'm newbie in the topic of Testnets and Retrodrops, so I apologize in advance if the question is incorrect.Could you clarify whether it is too late to participate in this quest? Where can I find details about its timing?Thanks in advance!Regarding the linea testnest quest I would say it almost too late because voyage 9 is just 20, and voyage 8 is ending by 11:59pm est with ridiculous gas fees, rest of voyage already ended meaning you can no longer perform task except ony the number one citizen task of 2500 points if it is still open, and the place to find more information about the linea Voyage is in galxe platform, you can find more other quest and test to perform when you visit the platform.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Bitstar_coin on July 06, 2023, 07:00:51 PMI couldn't complete the cashmere task because of the ridiculous gas fees, imagine to bridge Leth to Furji Avalanche network fees was 12 Leth, lol. I was having fun in all previous voyage, 7 was a little hectic but 8 was icing on the cake. Stressful and annoying to say the least.  I have a lots of undone task too mate. The complexity of some weeks are really high and not just that but the network cant really compensate the users doing it since a lot has been using and resulting to high gas fee and congestion. Anyway the party's already over and we can move on to others. Ive still open this thread just in anycase our testnet activity have beared fruits or Linea announce rewards for the points collected.

comments.author: cheezcarls
comments.body: Although beneficial for their project to have more interactions because of the gas fees, it seems fair for them to introduce the First Class Linea citizenship to reduce Sybil accounts. I just hope every Layer 1, 2, 3, etc., would do the same due to the Sybil issue. There are many factors that your wallet could get labeled as Sybil because of having multi-accounts, not doing transactions in other chains, etc.I started on the Week 5 of their campaign (stupid of me not aware of Linea's campaign in Galxe back then). I finished almost all points from Weeks 5 to 9 (missed one task on Week 7 which I am not eligible to mint that NFT due to not engaging in either the Bridge or NFT week. I've spent almost 30 Linea ETH just to finish all 425 points of their Week 8 quests, which I find it the most difficult and time consuming of them all.Much better to have one wallet alone but also very important for it not to be hacked by always double or triple check everything before proceeding.

comments.author: JunkieMiner
comments.body: I'm also taking part in Linea Voyage Quest, Although It has 9 weeks, in which yesterday that last week 9 week task. Here is the link below of week 9 which is very simple. https://galxe.com/Linea/campaign/GCvpxUetXY . Although the 2500 points task was I think 2 weeks old. So, making more points can give us benefit.

comments.author: nick_2017
comments.body: Quote from: Bitstar_coin on July 06, 2023, 08:31:16 PMQuote from: nick_2017 on July 06, 2023, 07:06:22 PMHi all.I'm newbie in the topic of Testnets and Retrodrops, so I apologize in advance if the question is incorrect.Could you clarify whether it is too late to participate in this quest? Where can I find details about its timing?Thanks in advance!Regarding the linea testnest quest I would say it almost too late because voyage 9 is just 20, and voyage 8 is ending by 11:59pm est with ridiculous gas fees, rest of voyage already ended meaning you can no longer perform task except ony the number one citizen task of 2500 points if it is still open, and the place to find more information about the linea Voyage is in galxe platform, you can find more other quest and test to perform when you visit the platform. Thank you so much for your answer! It is a pity that I was late for participation in this quest. I heard a lot of good things about this project.I wish everyone, who took part in this activity, good luck!

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: cheezcarls on July 07, 2023, 10:40:59 AMI started on the Week 5 of their campaign (stupid of me not aware of Linea's campaign in Galxe back then). I finished almost all points from Weeks 5 to 9 (missed one task on Week 7 which I am not eligible to mint that NFT due to not engaging in either the Bridge or NFT week. Its alright mate. I just wondered how the rewards will be computed since its a leaderboard style on galxe. But I heard that the rewards will be in a form of nft. What do you think? Does this nft comes with a lots of perks like tokens for linea network? Or probably another sale requirement on their IEO or ido on big platform?

comments.author: youdacapt
comments.body: Quote from: cryptoaddictchie on July 08, 2023, 11:02:21 AM Its alright mate. I just wondered how the rewards will be computed since its a leaderboard style on galxe. But I heard that the rewards will be in a form of nft. What do you think? Does this nft comes with a lots of perks like tokens for linea network? Or probably another sale requirement on their IEO or ido on big platform? I think the NFT by Linea for the Voyager Quest comes with hope. Why do i say hope? the NFT as reward is a form of recognition; The hodlers of the Voyager Quest NFTs can hope that when the Linea mainnet launches; and criteria's for the retroactive airdrop comes into play and is being determined, the Voyager Quest NFTs will be a criteria.Anything other than that means disappointment for every Voyager Quest participants.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: youdacapt on July 08, 2023, 12:28:32 PMAnything other than that means disappointment for every Voyager Quest participants.When you read the announcement about Linea Voyager quest nfts. They said that this not imply of a Linea token in the future means out side the linea nft they arent promisinf anything for the works done by the testnet participants. But we in the crypto space believe that there will be a token drop and this nft would be the requirement. Well its a tough one if they will not reward anyone who join especially their task are mind blowing on chain and off chain activities.

comments.author: cheezcarls
comments.body: Quote from: youdacapt on July 08, 2023, 12:28:32 PMQuote from: cryptoaddictchie on July 08, 2023, 11:02:21 AM Its alright mate. I just wondered how the rewards will be computed since its a leaderboard style on galxe. But I heard that the rewards will be in a form of nft. What do you think? Does this nft comes with a lots of perks like tokens for linea network? Or probably another sale requirement on their IEO or ido on big platform? I think the NFT by Linea for the Voyager Quest comes with hope. Why do i say hope? the NFT as reward is a form of recognition; The hodlers of the Voyager Quest NFTs can hope that when the Linea mainnet launches; and criteria's for the retroactive airdrop comes into play and is being determined, the Voyager Quest NFTs will be a criteria.Anything other than that means disappointment for every Voyager Quest participants.I usually welcome this especially for those who have completed the “First Class Citizen” quest on Galxe. The NFTs and OATs being earned in Galxe are going to give us special privileges as a “gateway” and “passport” for future big rewards. And also those projects who are introducing their own soul-bound passports.Like in Galxe they introduce a soul-bound Passport Holder NFT. Once you own that, every existing campaign in Galxe who requires you to have a passport are automatically qualified to receive points, NFTs, OATs, etc., for their own rewarding system. If you look at Aptos and Blur respectively, for just minting an NFT those holders are enjoying big retroactive drop rewards back then. What if we speculate that for Linea Voyager Quest NFT holders we will be eligible for the retroactive drop after mainnet launch? Or maybe even just an allocation for pre-IDO price like what SUI did last time? Anything’s possible!
